#Summary1=(human1) In a letter from August 6th 1964, William Helmuth Mathée seeks help from attorney John K. Bartram of Genoa City, Wis., in obtaining stolen letters from the estate of Isabelle's mother, Carrie Fulton Phillips, in hopes of having the letters destroyed if a judge allows it, or else surrendered to the Harding family, despite interest from historians in purchasing the letters.

#Summary2=(claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) On August 6, 1964, William Mathée writes to attorney John Bartram regarding the legal battle over possession of letters belonging to Isabelle's mother (Mrs. Phillips), discussing Williamson's mishandling of the letters, Isabelle's distress, and proposing options for the letters' disposition.

#Summary3=(gpt4o) In an August 6, 1964 letter, William Helmuth Mathée discusses legal concerns surrounding stolen personal letters belonging to Isabelle and the estate of Carrie Fulton Phillips, criticizing Williamson for mishandling the situation and expressing Isabelle's desire to destroy or return the letters to the Harding family, unless compelled by court action to sell them.

#Summary4=(Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct; postedited) William Helmuth Mathée delivers a scathing letter to John K. Bartram, criticizing Williamson's handling of Mrs. Phillips' stolen letters and seeking his help in resolving the matter.

#Summary5=(Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) William Helmuth Mathée writes to John K. Bartram to express frustration over the legal dispute regarding the ownership of Carrie Fulton Phillips' letters, detailing Isabelle's distress, questioning the actions of the estate's administrator, and discussing potential resolutions including appraisal and sale of the letters.
#Text=Genoa City , Wis.
#Text=August 6th 1964
#Text=John K. Bartram , Esquire
#Text=Attorney at Law
#Text=Bartram Building East Center Street
#Text=Marion , Ohio
#Text=Dear John ;
#Text=Thank you for your call of this afternoon .
#Text=It was a surprise for us to learn that apparently a decision was reached , perhaps by the judge that the letters are the property of Isabelle .

#Text=Michel advised her on May 25th as follows : " There is a grave legal question involved as to whether or not these letters are the property of your mother 's estate and an appropriate legal action is contemplated to determine such question . "

#Text=It is our considered opinion : Williamson should have sent them to the owner 's daughter as a very personal matter or auctioned them off when he sold Mrs. Phillips 's things on the auction block .
#Text=He did neither .
#Text=He sat on them 'til some reporter's warned him that they were hot merchandise .

#Text=Then with the idea of seeking cover made a judge ( apparently ignorant of the law ) appoint an administrator for Mrs. Phillips 's estate for stolen merchandise held in posession of a court appointed guardian of Mrs. Phillips .
#Text=To cap it all he permitted publication of these stolen letters by the press , although they were ordered by him to be under lock and key .
#Text=Now it appears that Williamson is trying to defend himself to the public .
#Text=A reporter from the Cleveland Press phoned on Monday last .
#Text=He said that he wanted to check on a statement made by Williamson , since he claimed that while he was Mrs. P 's guardian he had never heard from Isabelle .
#Text=We said ; " No comment " .
#Text=Isabelle was not advised that her mother had a guardian .

#Text=On Dec. 6th 1954 she had a power of attorney duly executed and witnessed by our attorney in Recine , Wis. in favor of Maud Gorham of Marion , Ohio especially to deal in all matters pertaining to Carrie Fulton Phillips .
#Text=We have not seen the Press article of this week , nor one the Marion Star or any Columbus paper might have had , covering an interview with Williamson .
#Text=If he does not leave Isabelle out of all of this he will have to suffer the consequences .
#Text=Perhaps you can warn him for me .
#Text=We will brand him with a libel iron , he wo n't forget .
#Text=The mental and heart suffering caused by this S.O.B to Isabelle is very deep , I can assure you , John .
#Text=She is sick & in doctor 's continual observation and care .

#Text=If there are no live debts to be satisfied and if the only assets in the reopened estate administrated by Michel are these stolen letters , now apparently determined to be the property of Isabelle , why on that decision alone , can not these letters be surrendered and the estate be closed because of lack of assets .

#Text=In that event , if you can succeed in getting that done , we would like to have the letters surrendered to you for destruction or surrender to the Harding family , as a possible value in checking the accuracy of any published stuff in the future .

#Text=If the Court insists on these letters being an asset and refuses to close the estate and insists that they be appraised and sold by the administrator at highest value offered , we would want to be sure that the sales price received covers the expenditures and that any trans-action in connection with such a sale remain entirely free from press and publication abuse .
#Text=John , as to the question of appraisers .
#Text=In our business of antiques , that of antiquarians , we have and must have in certain states , licensed appraisers .
#Text=All of them own their own respective businesses and sell .
#Text=Among them is Ralph Newman , who is also a historian .
#Text=Then of course there seem to be in this picture , so called historians , like the man you mentioned over the phone , Ed. K. Gross etc.
#Text=We even had inquiries from the Wisconsin State College , D. F. Costello , Prof.
#Text=A historian from Minneapolis wrote : would we sell the letters ?
#Text=These kind of historians want something for nothing and could not appraise anything of this kind , since they do not know corresponding values .
#Text=But all would want to take a look and see .
#Text=John , Isabelle does not want to sell the letters unless we are forced to do so by the judge and his court under the auspices of estate jurisdiction .
#Text=She has never seen them , knew nothing of their existence and does not care to see them now or ever .
#Text=There are to ways out : 1) according to Paragraph 1 & 2 of this page and the preceeding paragraph , as we see it .
#Text=In the first instance we would want to pay you your bill on conclusion or before as you like .
#Text=In the second instance we wonder if you might take for a third of the net or how you would like to be compensated .
#Text=In the meanrime with all best regards from the both of us ,
#Text=Sincerely , [ William Helmuth Mathée ]
